thread.title: Old School Wrestling show on tap at Hanahan Rec Center
thread.title_full: Old School Wrestling show on tap at Hanahan Rec Center

title: Old School Wrestling show on tap at Hanahan Rec Center
text: Old School Wrestling show on tap at Hanahan Rec Center Staff reports Facebook @postandcourier Oct 10 2015 11:28 pm Blythewood native and USC grad John Skyler will headline an Old School Championship Wrestling show at the Hanahan Rec Center. PROVIDED × Old School Championship Wrestling will return to the Hanahan Rec Center on Sunday. The main event will feature a four-on-four elimination match pitting John Skyler, Gangrel, Jon Malus and a mystery partner (managed by Reginald Vanderhoff) against Brandon Paradise, BJ Hancock, Nick Kismet and Brady Pierce (managed by Bob Keller). Others on the bill include James Island’s Peter “Superhuman” Kaasa, Chase Brown, The Flock (Lodi and Sick Boy), The Washington Bullets, The Varsity (Eric Bradford and Zane Riley), Kevin Phoenix, Asylum, Michael Frehley, Cali Casanova and Ms. Harden. Action starts at 5 p.m. Doors open at 4:30. Adult admission is $10 (cash at the door); kids 12 and under $5. For more information, call 843-743-4800 or visit www.oscwonline.com. Keywords
